original: Leffler, Hakon, civilingenjör, direktör, Göteborg, f. 11/3/87 i Gbg av grosshandl. Carl L. o. Hanna Delban-co. G. 13 m. Märta von Bahr. Barn: 37 Jan f. 14, • civ :ing. v. Gamlestadens Fabr. A-B, Göran 17, adv. v. Dr Philip Lemans Adv :byrå, Gbg, Staffan 21, stud. v. band rhögsk. — Mogiex. v. Gbgs h. real 05, KTH (E) 05-08, res:-off :ex. 09, fil. kand. i Upps. 10. Und:-löjtn. i Göta artireg. res. 09, löjtn. 15, avsk. 19. Anst. i firma M. E. Del-banco i Gbg 12-15, verkst. dir. i Sv. Oljeslag. A-B 16-29, v. verkst. dir. i Gamlestadens Fabr. A-B 29-34, num. verkst. dir. o. styr:led. där. Led. av styr. f. Gbgs Sparbank 21, Ränte- o. Kapitalförsäkr :anst. i Gbg 22, Skand. Kredit A-B 26, Boxholms A-B 29, Sjö-försäkr. A-B Gauthiod 31, num. v. styr :ordf. där, v. OTdf. i styr. f. Brand-& Livförsäkr. A-B Svea, Sv. Socker-fabr. A-B, Sv:es textilind iförb. m. m., ordf. i styr. f. Gbgs spårv. 22-27, led. av stadsfullm. 21-22 o. 24-26, v. ordf. i hand:kamm. 35. En av Sv:es skickl. tennisspelare under åren 05-13, vann bl. a. SM utomhus i single 06. RNO, RVO.
translated: Leffler, Hakon, engineer, director, Gothenburg, b. 11/3/87 in Gothenburg to merchant Carl L. and Hanna Delban-co. Married to Märta von Bahr in 1913. Children: Jan, born in 1914, civil engineer at Gamlestadens Fabr. A-B in Gothenburg, Göran, 17, lawyer at Dr Philip Lemans Law Firm in Gothenburg, Staffan, 21, student at a university. Completed higher education at Gbgs h. real in 1905, KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) from 1905-1908, reserve officer exam in 1909, bachelor's degree in Uppsala in 1910. Second Lieutenant in Göta Artillery Regiment from 1909, Lieutenant in 1915, retired in 1919. Employed at M. E. Delbanco firm in Gothenburg from 1912-1915, executive director at Sv. Oljeslag. A-B from 1916-1929, executive director at Gamlestadens Fabr. A-B from 1929-1934, currently serving as executive director and board member there. Board member of Goteborgs Sparbank from 1921, Ränte- o. Kapitalförsäkr :anst. in Gothenburg from 1922, Skand. Kredit A-B in 1926, Boxholms A-B in 1929, Sjö-försäkr. A-B Gauthiod in 1931, currently serving as chairman of the board there, vice chairman of the board of Brand- & Life Insurance A-B Svea, Sv. Socker-fabr. A-B, Sv:es textilind iförb., etc. Chairman of the board of Gothenburg tramway from 1922-1927, member of the city council from 1921-1922 and 1924-1926, vice chairman of the Chamber of Commerce in 1935. One of Sweden's skilled tennis players from 1905-1913, won, among other titles, the Swedish Championship in singles in 1906. Awarded RNO, RVO..

awards.name: Royal Order of the Polar Star
